jobs.title: Enterprise Account Executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

The Role

As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will be responsible for landing and expanding Compa’s presence within the world’s most innovative enterprise organizations. You’ll drive strategic deals by targeting key peer companies in our anchor tenant strategy, helping compensation leaders unlock real-time market intelligence. You’ll own the full sales cycle—from creative prospecting to closing—and collaborate closely with marketing, insights, and product to drive results.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, early-stage environment and wants to make a direct impact on revenue growth, customer success, and product direction.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of enterprise SaaS sales experience, with a strong track record of closing complex, high-value deals

  • Experience selling into HR, People, or Compensation teams at large enterprise companies

  • Proven ability to manage long sales cycles and build relationships with VP- and C-level stakeholders

  • Creative and persistent prospecting across email, events, partnerships, referrals, and beyond

  • Strong consultative selling and storytelling abilities, with a talent for problem-solving with customers

  • Self-starter mentality with a strong sense of ownership and comfort working in ambiguity

  • Familiarity with CRM and sales engagement tools (e.g., HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Background working with or selling into Compensation or Total Rewards functions

  • Exposure to or interest in agentic AI technologies and enterprise AI adoption

  • Experience contributing to early-stage product or GTM strategy in a startup environment

  • Strong cross-functional collaboration skills across Product, Marketing, and Customer Success

  • Track record of helping build and refine sales processes, content, and customer materials

#BI-Remote

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer, UI Focus
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

🎨 About the role

You will lead product design on several projects simultaneously. In this role, you will report to our Product Design Manager who has an extensive background in both product design and managing design teams.

We believe great design starts with listening to customers and not a predefined list of requirements. You’ll take an active role in shaping product strategy by consistently advocating for user needs. You’ll know, because you’ll be talking with them.

Good design is much more than how things look, it’s how they work. We encourage our engineering and growth teams to engage actively in product discussions. Your facilitation will be crucial in drawing out the best ideas from across our teams, fostering a culture of innovation, and navigating the trade-offs necessary to build the right products.

We expect a broad set of design capabilities. As a lead product designer you will:

  • Collaborate with the team on problem discovery and definition

  • Uncover and distill user needs / insights through customer interviews and product analytics

  • Design and prototype multiple ideas quickly, connecting regularly with users to validate them

  • Deliver balanced user experiences that are high quality, easy to use, and ship quickly

  • Have a strong point of view on how our product should look & feel

  • Lead and participate in user interviews, turning insights into actionable design decisions and sharing learnings to align the broader team.

  • Evaluate shipped work to ensure it solves our user needs and meets our goals

  • Continuously improve our design processes —shaping systems rather than just following them.

  • Collaborate closely with cross-functional partners, including product managers, engineers, and business stakeholders shaping product direction.

  • Actively give and receive feedback across teams, clearly presenting design rationale and aligning stakeholders on vision, goals, and user value.

👋 About you

  • An exceptional UI designer, and consider it a core skill within your broader product design capabilities.

  • 5+ years in product design roles

  • Experience working with remote teams as a design lead on large projects

  • Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment typical of growing startups.

  • Get things done, are incredibly resourceful, and have an ownership mindset

  • Comfortable leading user research initiatives and talking to customers

  • Relentlessly iterate and simplify to find the right trade-offs help us ships sooner to users

  • Experience in designing data-based UIs & data visualizations is a plus

  • Communicate clearly, concisely, and proactively

  • Can deftly articulate rationale behind design decisions

  • Are humble, and give/take constructive feedback well

🧰 Our Design Tech Stack

  • Figma

  • AI Builder/Prototyping Tools

  • Notion

  • Linear

  • Storybook

  • Mixpanel

  • Slack

#BI-Remote

jobs.title: Engineering Manager, Applied AI
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

Location:

While Compa is a remote friendly company, for this role there is a preference for candidates located near one of our offices in Irvine, CA, Denver, CO or Boston, MA.

The Role:

Compa is looking for an Engineering Manager to build and lead our first Applied AI Team. This is a unique opportunity to own and shape how we apply machine learning across both customer-facing products and internal systems. You’ll operate as a player-coach—contributing hands-on to ML projects while building a high-performing team from the ground up.

You'll work closely with Compa’s Co-founder & CTO to define the team’s technical vision, processes, and success metrics. You’ll collaborate cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, CS, and Design to identify high-impact opportunities and ship production-grade ML systems that support comp decisions at the world’s most sophisticated companies.

You’ll be responsible for end-to-end ownership of applied AI initiatives, including model development, MLOps, roadmap planning, infrastructure alignment, and organizational process design.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 7+ years of experience as a technical lead or manager on ML or Applied AI teams

  • Proven experience shipping production ML models in customer-facing or business-critical applications

  • Strong engineering fundamentals and a “builder” mindset—you’re comfortable rolling up your sleeves to write or review code

  • Familiarity with modern ML tooling, MLOps practices, and model evaluation pipelines

  • Experience collaborating with Product Managers and cross-functional stakeholders to translate ambiguous problems into technical strategies

  • Strong communication and leadership skills, with experience aligning teams and driving delivery

  • Ability to create and scale process, tooling, and team practices in a fast-paced, early-stage environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience building ML systems in a startup or zero-to-one context

  • Experience partnering with Infrastructure and Data Engineering teams to shape dev environments for ML

  • Knowledge of compensation, HR tech, or enterprise SaaS workflows (a plus, not required)

  • Exposure to agentic systems, predictive modeling, or real-time data products

  • Familiarity with vendor selection, cost planning, or cloud architecture decisions related to ML (in collaboration with leadership)

  • A track record of mentoring or developing engineering talent on technical projects

#BI-Remote

jobs.title: Engineering Manager, Core Infrastructure
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

Location:
While Compa is a remote friendly company, for this role there is a preference for candidates located near one of our offices in Irvine, CA, Denver, CO or Boston, MA

The Role:

Compa is hiring an Engineering Manager to build and lead our first Core Infrastructure Team. This is a rare opportunity to define and scale the infrastructure that powers every layer of our platform—from web app hosting and conventional AI to self-hosted generative models, business intelligence, and secure customer data environments.

This role is perfect for a technically strong player-coach who wants to both build and lead. You’ll own roadmap planning, delivery, and execution of key infra initiatives (including multi-cloud and customer-managed encryption), and partner closely with Compa’s CTO and engineering leads to shape DevOps and scaling strategy.

As the first hire on this team, you’ll establish foundational processes, build the infra hiring loop, and directly impact product velocity, system reliability, and technical excellence across the company.

In this role, you will:

  • Build and lead Compa’s first infrastructure team

  • Set strategy, roadmap, and success metrics for core infrastructure

  • Be a hands-on contributor and technical mentor (including oncall rotation)

  • Own major company initiatives like multi-cloud support and data encryption

  • Collaborate across engineering, product, and cross-functional leadership to identify opportunities and de-risk scaling challenges

  • Manage Compa’s hosting budget and vendor selection for cloud infrastructure

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a technical lead or manager in an infrastructure or DevOps-focused team

  • Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure, hosting, service reliability, and platform scaling

  • Ability to contribute to code, perform oncall duties, and review high-quality engineering work

  • Strong project management skills with a track record of delivering high-impact infrastructure projects

  • Experience building and scaling developer tools, CI/CD, observability, or internal platforms

  • Excellent collaboration and communication skills; ability to work cross-functionally with Product, Eng, and XFN leads

  • Comfort owning budgeting, vendor evaluation, and managing infrastructure costs

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience leading a team through multi-cloud migrations or encryption key management

  • A “player-coach” mindset—able to ship while building the team and processes

  • Familiarity with MLOps, AI infrastructure, or tooling for data-intensive systems

  • Experience supporting both internal engineering velocity and production system reliability

  • Strong mentorship abilities and a passion for developing high-performing engineers

  • Experience building infra in a fast-paced startup or high-growth B2B SaaS environment

#BI-Remote

jobs.title: Software Engineer, All Teams
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

Location:

While Compa is a remote friendly company, for this role there is a preference for candidates located near one of our offices in Irvine, CA, Denver, CO or Boston, MA.

The Role:

At Compa, we’re building the future of enterprise compensation. Our platform helps the world’s largest companies make smarter, fairer, and more transparent pay decisions—powered by live data and thoughtful design.

As a Software Engineer, you’ll have significant ownership and autonomy to build the systems and infrastructure that power Compa’s core products. You’ll work across the stack, collaborate closely with product and design, and contribute to features that directly impact enterprise customers.

In this role, you will:

  • Ship production-grade software across Compa’s web app and backend systems

  • Build new features and improve existing workflows in collaboration with Product and Design

  • Write clean, scalable code and contribute to system architecture decisions

  • Participate in code reviews, team rituals, and roadmap discussions

  • Solve real problems for enterprise compensation teams—from data pipelines to user experience

Minimum Qualifications

  • 2+ years of experience shipping production software in a collaborative environment

  • Strong proficiency in at least one modern web development language or framework

  • Comfortable working across the stack or specializing in either frontend or backend

  • Proven ability to work autonomously and follow through on commitments

  • Pragmatic and thoughtful about trade-offs—focus on outcomes over tools

  • Strong communication and collaboration skills

Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience in early-stage or high-growth startup environments

  • Familiarity with compensation, HR tech, or enterprise SaaS (not required)

  • Experience working on data-driven products or complex user workflows

  • Interest or experience in AI systems or ML infrastructure (a plus, not a requirement)

  • Comfortable navigating ambiguity and working in fast-paced, iterative environments

Tech Stack

You don’t need experience with all of these, but familiarity with any is a plus:

  • Backend: Django, Python

  • Frontend: React, TypeScript, GraphQL

  • Infrastructure: AWS

  • Other Tools: vLLM, Linear, Slack, Notion, Metabase

#BI-Remote

jobs.title: Compensation Analyst
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

The Role:

We are seeking a Compensation Analyst to support Compa’s customers in understanding, implementing, and getting value from our platform. This role blends compensation knowledge, data expertise, and customer-facing communication. You’ll educate customers on how Compa solves compensation challenges, support onboarding and implementation, and contribute to thought leadership through insights and content.

Key Responsibilities:

Customer Education & Engagement

  • Deliver demos, trainings, and research that explain how Compa’s offerings and how they address compensation challenges.

Insights & Content Development

  • Identify trends and insights using Compa’s data network.

  • Contribute to research, blog posts, guides, and other educational content.

Onboarding & Data Mapping

  • Partner with new customers to interpret compensation data and map it into Compa’s platform.

  • Ensure accurate and efficient setup to accelerate time-to-value.

Data Review & Optimization

  • Analyze and validate customer data to troubleshoot issues and ensure accuracy.

  • Make light system configuration updates (e.g., mapping fields, updating structures, enabling settings) to optimize efficiency.

  • Recommend and implement data updates to improve efficiency and system performance.

  • Collaborate with product and support teams to resolve complex data challenges.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • Familiarity with HR technology systems and comfort working with technology systems.

  • Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data tools (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex topics clearly.

  • Comfort working directly with customers and prospects in both technical and advisory capacities

Preferred Qualifications:

  • At least 3 years of experience in compensation

  • Deep knowledge of compensation benchmarking

  • Familiarity with all elements of compensation (base, incentives, equity)

  • Experience creating or contributing to educational content (guides, reports, articles).

  • System configuration

  • Data analysis and proficiency in advanced data analysis (SQL, Python, etc.)

#BI-Remote

 - Make light system configuration updates (e.g., mapping fields, updating structures, enabling settings) to optimize efficiency.

 - Recommend and implement data updates to improve efficiency and system performance.

 - Collaborate with product and support teams to resolve complex data challenges.


MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

 - Familiarity with HR technology systems and comfort working with technology systems.

 - Strong analytical skills with proficiency in data tools (e.g., Excel, Google Sheets, or similar).

 - Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to explain complex topics clearly.

 - Comfort working directly with customers and prospects in both technical and advisory capacities


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

 - At least 3 years of experience in compensation

 - Deep knowledge of compensation benchmarking

 - Familiarity with all elements of compensation (base, incentives, equity)

 - Experience creating or contributing to educational content (guides, reports, articles).

 - System configuration

 - Data analysis and proficiency in advanced data analysis (SQL, Python, etc.)

jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

The Role:

UI Engineering at Compa is the connective layer between product intent and user experience; where decisions around structure, interaction, and maintainability all converge.

This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of design, product, engineering, and user experience. You’ll help translate ideas into elegant, functional interfaces; shaping not just how things look, but how they work and evolve.

You’ll be joining an existing lead UIE to scale Compa’s UI infra and products.

Software engineers at Compa have a high degree of ownership and autonomy to build the systems powering the future of enterprise compensation at a global scale.

Compa has a wide breadth of projects that will continue to expand as we grow. A few examples of projects are: finding new ways to bring its unique data to HR teams, leveraging Artificial Intelligence to unlock new insights and predictions related to the labor market, building tools to scale our internal operations, ensuring engineering excellence throughout our stack, and maintaining our enterprise grade security posture.

You will join Compa’s world-class, in-house engineering team and partner with Compa’s co-founders to build and scale the company, it’s systems, and products.

You have a high-level of trust and autonomy to build our core systems and influence the product roadmap.

About you

  • As our next UIE, you should have 5+ years of experience shipping beautiful products — you care about your craft

  • Want to make help figure out how to make compensation more transparent, fair, and equitable

  • Proven track record of shipping products

  • Pragmatic instincts - you think first about the interaction of systems and people rather than the latest technical fad

  • Comfortable executing in high ambiguous and constantly changing situations

  • Have a bias for action - transform ambiguity and uncertainty into concrete next steps

  • Able to overcome obstacles to ship - done is better than perfect!

  • Collaborative problem solver

  • Looking to realize your potential by engaging with challenging problems, both technical and societal

Technologies

Here’s our stack:

  • React JS

  • Typescript

  • Emotion CSS

  • GraphQL via Apollo

  • Django

  • Python

  • AWS

You don’t need to have prior experience with these exact technologies but some experience is a plus.

jobs.title: Director of Sales
jobs.descriptionHtml:
🚀 About Compa

Compa is a venture-backed SaaS startup revolutionizing the future of compensation.

In a dynamic job market with hiring challenges, accountability, and the rise of AI, companies need the best data to stay ahead of industry changes, competition, and costs. Compa has developed the premier real-time compensation data platform, delivering top-tier compensation intelligence to leading enterprise teams.

Compa is a compensation intelligence company built to augment enterprise compensation teams in the era of AI.

Our customers include the world’s biggest companies: Apple, NVIDIA, Tesla, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Sanofi, Moderna, Gilead Sciences, and more.

The Role:

We’re looking for a Sales Director to lead and expand our enterprise go-to-market efforts. In this role, you’ll own the full sales cycle—from prospecting to close—while helping to shape the sales playbook, define new vertical strategies, and partner cross-functionally with Product, Marketing, and Customer Success. You’ll focus on building relationships with senior stakeholders across Fortune 1000 companies and drive adoption of Compa’s platform, including our newest agentic AI products, Partner AI and Analyst AI.

This is a high-impact opportunity to join an early-stage company at the forefront of AI and HR tech, with a direct hand in accelerating revenue and influencing product direction.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • 8+ years of B2B SaaS sales experience, with a proven track record of closing large enterprise deals

  • Deep experience selling to VP+ stakeholders within enterprise organizations

  • Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills

  • Ability to navigate complex sales cycles and manage multiple stakeholders

  • Strong cross-functional collaboration skills with experience partnering with Product and Marketing teams

  • Self-starter with a bias toward action and comfort working in a fast-paced, early-stage environment

  • Experience using CRM and sales enablement tools (e.g., HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator)

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience selling AI or agentic AI products into enterprise businesses

  • Prior experience in HR tech, compensation, or people analytics

  • Understanding of the enterprise procurement process and budgeting cycles

  • Background in consultative or solution-based selling with long sales cycles

  • Passion for building processes and mentoring early-stage sales teams
